attributes.action: Negotiate fairer discounted travel for 5-15 year old's in West Sussex.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the 3in1 scheme the cost for a Metrovoyager ticket was £76.50 for 13 weeks, saving parents £8 per week that's £104 over the 13 weeks. This will be for all children and young people who used the scheme. The options now available are included in the following link.
https://www.metrobus.co.uk/childstudent-eligibility-and-id-requirements/ 
This has the potential to have an impact on children's opportunities to travel to their chosen school as not all parents can afford the rising costs.
attributes.background: The 3in1 card gave children in West Sussex affordable bus travel to allow them to travel to school at a reasonable price. Metrobus, Crawley has only provided a 25% discount to 16+ as long as they are a full time student. This will cause travel costs for parents double especially if under 16.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to withdraw the 3in1 scheme was taken by West Sussex County Council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:

https://www.westsussex.gov.uk/about-the-council/have-your-say/submit-a-petition-to-the-county-council/
